comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: A man named Dan Tachet is described as "presiding over the commissary" on Sierra Club outings in the 1920s and 1930s. Ansel Adams made a portrait of him on one such outing. www.andrewsmithgallery.com/exhibitions/anseladams/sierra_... He's credited as Chef Dan Tachet of Castaneda in Las Vegas in this set of recipes in a 1910 magazine (albondigas soup, enchiladas, etc.): books.google.com/books?id=dP1KAAAAYAAJ&lpg=RA3-PA77&a...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.thehighsierra.org/portraits.htm has a picture of him as an older man, probably in 1931. See www.thehighsierra.org/mountaineering_summer_1931.htm And emuseum.icp.org/view/objects/asitem/People$00402143/0/pri... claims to be a 1929 portrait by Ansel Adams.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you both so very much for your research. I wonder if Adams took this photo, as well as the the one in the collection at the Andrew Smith Gallery.  We can certainly add some of the information to the record the next time we update.
